config.question: Five-year-old Trent observes his neighbor, 7-year-old Charlie, playing T-ball with his friends. Trent’s interest is piqued, so his mother signs him up for instructional T-ball. Trent’s coach notices that Trent is having difficulty hitting the ball off of the T, so he places his hands over Trent’s on the bat and helps him swing. Trent hits a home run and is delighted. According to Vygotsky, this is an example of ________.

answer_3.response: Consider this: ZPD is the level at which a child can almost, but not fully, perform a task independently, but can do so with the assistance of someone more competent. LO 4.7 What separates Vygotsky’s approach from Piaget’s?
